es.upm.ies.goniophotometer.utils

Class PropsMngr

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.upm.ies.goniophotometer.utils.PropsMngr

  • public final class PropsMngr
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to manage the properties of a program.

    Programs that are developed to maximize compatibility have to deal with the problem of defining default properties. When distributing the program, the users will surely change the default properties to those that suit best at that moment. However, when they restore to the default properties they may not want to restore all the properties to the manufactured default properties (those set by the developer when writing the code). Instead, the may want to restore the properties to a default value set by them (probably in the first use). For this reason, this class has three set of properties:

    • Developer defaults: Properties set by the developer. Probably useless to the user, but a start point when executing the program. Furthermore, if something goes wrong with the properties files, the program using this class can restore this set of properties instead of crashing. They must be hard-coded by the programmer using setDeveloperDefaults method and not read from a file.
    • Default properties: The values of this properties are the same as the developer defaults at first. However, they can be changed by the user in order to establish a point-of-return. They are stored in a file called default_config.properties.
    • Properties: These are the current properties defined by the user. They are recovered session after session from a file called config.properties. They can be restored whenever the user wants to the default values (from the default properties set).
    Author:
    Abdón Alejandro Vivas Imparato

        Returns:

      • saveProps

        public void saveProps()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the properties to a file named config.properties.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • saveDefaults

        public void saveDefaults()
        Saves the default properties to a file named default_config.properties.

      • loadProperties

        public void loadProperties()
        Loads the properties from the file config.properties. If the properties has different keys than the developer defaults after loading, then the defaults are written to the properties.

      • loadDefaultProperties

        public void loadDefaultProperties()
        Loads the default properties from the file default_config.properties. If the default properties has different keys than the developer defaults after loading, then the developer defaults are written to the default properties.

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the property value with the specified key value. If the key is not found, it assigns its value to be the default value and returns the default value. If the key isn't among the defaults either, it assigns its value according to the developer defaults and then returns it.
        Parameters:
        key - The property key.
        Returns:
        The value with the specified key value.

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the value of the property with the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - The value to be set.
        value - The property key.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mapProps)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the properties specified in a KEY-VALUE HashMap<String, String>.
        Parameters:
        mapProps - HashMap with the specified properties to be set. It must have a (KEY,VALUE) format.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

        value - The value to be set

      • setDeveloperDefaults

        public void setDeveloperDefaults(java.util.Properties developerDefaults)
        Sets the developer defaults. It is important to make a call to this method right after calling to getInstance() for the first time in your code. The parameter developerDefaults must contain all the properties that are going to be used through your program. After setting the developer defaults, it calls loadDefaults.
        Parameters:
        developerDefaults - Properties instance with all the properties to be used through the program.

      • restoreDefaults

        public void restoreDefaults()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Assign the default value to all the properties.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • mkPropsDefault

        public void mkPropsDefault()
        Convert the current properties into default properties.
